topic.title: HP Helion OpenStack Carrier Grade 2.0 Alpha: Applying the HLM Port Security Patch

body.p: The HLM VM has all its ports open for inbound and outbound access after it has been deployed. The HLM ports must be open for inbound access from all the cloud nodes
If security is a concern, all ports on HLM except for the standard ports like SSH, HTTP, HTTPS etc must be blocked for inbound access.
This patch secures all ports on the HLM VM. The standard protocol ports will allow inbound access only and the only the cloud nodes will have inbound access to the other ports of the HLM VM.

If your HP Helion OpenStack Carrier Grade cloud is being used in a production environment, we recommend applying this patch. If your cloud is in a proof-of-concept (POC) environment, where external access is not a concern, this patch is not recommended and is not necessary.
You should have downloaded the patch files in the Prerequisites.
Use the following steps to apply this patch:

ol.li: Copy the secure_HLM_ports_patch_1.1.tar.gz file to the ~/patch_cghelion1.1 directory. cp secure_HLM_ports_patch_1.1.tar.gz ~/patch_cghelion1.1
Use the following command to extract the random-password.tar.gz: tar -zxvf secure_HLM_ports_patch_1.1.tar.gz

Copy the extracted the files: cp ~/patch_cghelion1.1/hlmiptables ~/<cloudname>/clouds/<cloudname>/001/stage/ansible/roles/ cp ~/patch_cghelion1.1/secureHLM.yml ~/<cloudname>/clouds/<cloudname>/001/stage/ansible/

Edit the ~/<cloudname>/clouds/<cloudname>/001/stage/ansible/group_vars/all file to add the following varible before the line that contains global. Specify the cloud name in all capital letters: cloud_nodes_hostgroup: <cloudname>
where <cloudname> is the name of the cloud you created.
Example: The first lines of your group_vars/all file should look like following:# Cloud: ovs (ovs) # Variables in this file are applicable to the "all" host group cloud_nodes_hostgroup: OVS global: ansible_vars: compute_virt_type: qemu dns_address: 10.10.10.25 dns_domain_name: helion.cg ext_dns_ip: 10.10.10.25 ssl_cert_file: /root/ovs/ca.crt --------
Run following command: cd ~/<cloudname>/clouds/<cloudname>/001/stage/ansible/ansible-playbook -i hosts secureHLM.yml --ask-pass
Enter the password for the HLM root user (by default, cghelion) and hit enter.
This should run the hlmiptables role which will secure all ports on HLM

body.p: Return to the KVM + ESX installation.
